envision a scenario where governmental surveillance tracks your movements at every turn.
whether you board a train in the morning, hop on a bus to reach your workplace, or take a ferry for a client meeting, your journeys on all public transportation modes are meticulously logged in a burgeoning database, creating a comprehensive profile of your whereabouts.
while this may seem like a sensationalized plot from a hollywood blockbuster or reminiscent of an nsa-style surveillance program limited to america, the reality is much closer to home.
with the impending introduction of the opal card payment system by the nsw government to replace conventional paper tickets on sydney's public transport network, this level of tracking could soon become routine for commuters.
trials are already underway on ferries and a train line, with plans for a gradual rollout on a broader scale throughout the nsw transport network by the following year.
the government's primary goal is to streamline the travel experience for customers, eliminating the need for paper tickets and offering a convenient payment method.
by simply loading funds onto the opal card and swiping at entry and exit points, or when boarding a bus, passengers can enjoy a hassle-free journey.
the system also allows for automatic top-ups by linking the opal card to a credit card.
while current discussions mainly focus on the system's advantages, associated costs, and potential fare adjustments, one aspect that has received less attention is the extensive people-tracking capabilities that opal could present, possibly making it the most extensive surveillance system implemented in australia.

in 1915, a doomed journey referred to as the ross sea party headed towards the new zealand side of antarctica with the purpose of establishing supply depots for explorers.
when their ship drifted away from the moorings, the group of six men found themselves marooned, facing a fierce battle for survival during their three-year ordeal on the icy continent before finally being rescued.
fast forward almost a century later, a recent revelation implies that the men may have left behind more than previously thought.
during the restoration of one of the supply huts used by the party, antarctic conservators stumbled upon a collection of 22 undeveloped cellulose nitrate negatives, believed to have been left there by the ross sea party.
these images offer fresh perspectives of ross island, mcmurdo sound, and two previously unseen photographs of the expedition's lead scientist, alexander stevens, further solidifying their connection to the expedition.
remarkably, despite the extensive time spent in the harsh icy conditions, most of the photo damage was localized to the edges.
through meticulous efforts, the conservators managed to achieve a nearly flawless restoration of the photographs.
the fully restored images are now accessible for viewing on the antarctic heritage trust website.

nasa scientists have issued a warning about a significant crack in the antarctic ice sheet that is rapidly widening and may result in the formation of a massive iceberg in the coming months.
the crack, located in western antarctica's pine island glacier, spans at least 30 kilometers in length and 50 meters in depth.
according to nasa's findings, the rift is expanding at a pace of two meters per day.
nasa project scientist michael studinger confirmed the rate of widening and predicts that the ice will eventually break, resulting in an iceberg exceeding 880 square kilometers.
despite concerns, studinger clarified that the process is a natural occurrence and not directly linked to global warming.
he anticipates the formation of the large iceberg later this year or early next year as part of the glacier's regular cycle.

in most cases, a drone crashing and breaking apart could ruin your day.
however, the innovative airblock drone from makeblock, a robotics startup in shenzhen, offers a unique solution.
designed with a modular concept, airblock allows you to effortlessly reassemble the drone in moments after a crash.
its components, including the central processor, motors, and rotors, are safely housed within a protective styrofoam frame and effortlessly connect with magnetic connectors.

operating in a globalized world implies that human society is now interconnected and interdependent across all facets of human life, forming a singular, fully integrated system.
despite ongoing debates in regions like europe about the necessary levels of integration to preserve unity, the reality is that the system we inhabit naturally encompasses comprehensive integration.
by clinging to the idea that individuals and nations can operate independently, we resist the evolutionary pressures of our existence.
a global, integral system thrives on cooperative interactions rather than cutthroat competition.
insisting on competition, as some experts still advocate, is akin to endorsing a destructive force over a healthy one.
this truth is increasingly apparent not just in theory but in current events, evident in daily news updates, statistical trends, and the evident desperation at high-stakes international meetings.
our only viable option is to willingly adapt to this system to unlock its vast potential.
embracing this cooperative paradigm could lead to unprecedented advantages within the global, integral, and natural system that surrounds us.
shifting away from perpetual conflicts, setbacks, and inefficiencies, we would seamlessly coexist by aligning with the system rather than working against it.

their fresh idea introduces a torus structure—an inflatable innertube surrounded by a shell made of water ice.

due to a shortage of roman catholic clergy in the united states, priests from india have stepped in to perform masses for specific intentions, creating a form of outsourcing within the church.
churches from countries like the united states, canada, and europe send their requests, known as mass intentions, to indian clergy for services such as memorial prayers for deceased loved ones, thanksgiving prayers, and other special intentions.
india, with a christian population of about 2 percent, primarily catholics, sees a significant number of mass intentions coming from overseas, particularly from kerala, a state on the southwestern coast known for its high concentration of christians.
the masses are conducted in malayalam, the local language, with the intentions ranging from prayers for the deceased, healing of family members, gratitude for answered prayers, to blessings for newborns.
these requests are mostly channeled through channels like the vatican, bishops, or religious organizations to churches in kerala, with some received directly by individual priests.
while most requests are traditionally made in person or through mail by traveling clergy, there is an increasing trend of requests being sent via email, showcasing how technology is facilitating and expediting this practice.

the altai region in southern siberia has played a significant role in the settlement of northern asia and is believed to be a possible homeland for ancestral native americans.
with a long history dating back to the paleolithic era, the altai region is currently inhabited by various turkic-speaking ethnic groups, categorized into northern and southern clusters based on linguistic, cultural, and anthropological characteristics.
to explore the genetic histories of the altaians, we conducted a detailed analysis of mtdna and y chromosome variations among populations from both the northern and southern regions.
the mtdna analysis involved pcr-rflp and control region sequencing, while the y chromosome study included over 100 biallelic markers and 17 y-strs.
our findings revealed distinct differences in the origins and population histories of the altai ethnic groups, with northern altaians showing similarities to yeniseian, ugric, and samoyedic speakers to the north, while southern altaians displayed closer connections to other turkic-speaking populations in southern siberia and central asia.
additionally, through a thorough investigation of the y chromosome haplogroup q, we were able to revise the phylogeny of this lineage, establishing clearer links between populations in the old and new worlds and indicating a recent common ancestor shared between southern altaians and native americans.
these results significantly contribute to our comprehension of the migration patterns from siberia to the americas.

today's incarnation is guru nanak, a poet who founded sikhism in the 15th century, establishing one of the great world religions.
similar to historical figures such as the buddha and mahavira of jainism, nanak lived a nomadic life, traveling extensively for 25 years to places like mecca and the himalayas.
unlike his predecessors, upon attaining enlightenment, nanak returned to punjab, emphasizing to his followers the importance of engaging with the world rather than withdrawing from it.
he promoted a philosophy of 'disciplined worldliness,' highlighting the significance of work and family.
nanak also introduced the concept of langar, a communal meal served in sikh temples worldwide, where people of all backgrounds dine together as equals, transcending societal barriers.
sunil khilnani delves into the legacy of nanak, exploring his revolutionary ideas that challenged the existing religious norms.
by proclaiming "there is neither hindu nor muslim," nanak advocated for a distinct path rather than a blend of religions, ultimately founding a unique faith with approximately 30 million followers globally.
the program was produced by jeremy grange, featuring original music by talvin singh.

he has pleaded guilty to piracy-related charges in norfolk, virginia, and is now facing a potential 30-year prison sentence.
five other somali individuals are also facing legal actions in connection with the incident.
prosecutors emphasized that this is norfolk's first piracy-related conviction in 150 years and stressed the importance of holding modern-day pirates accountable.
following an agreement with authorities, ibrahim pleaded guilty to charges including attacking to plunder a vessel, committing violence against individuals on a vessel, and using a firearm during a violent crime.
both ibrahim and the authorities have concurred on a 30-year imprisonment term, with a sentencing hearing scheduled for 29 november.
recently, a piracy charge carrying a mandatory life sentence was dismissed against ibrahim and his alleged accomplices by a judge.
the group attacked the uss ashland in the gulf of aden on 10 april using a skiff to fire upon it.
in response, us navy personnel returned fire, leading to the death of one somali and destruction of their skiff.
the judge nullified the more severe piracy accusation as the group did not steal from, board, or take control of the us navy ship.
somalia has been plagued by internal conflicts for over two decades, fostering a breeding ground for piracy due to the prevailing lawlessness.
typically, foreign countries have been hesitant to prosecute suspects domestically, allowing pirates to evade consequences even after failed attacks.

according to a senior official from a private sector bank, banks have implemented a new rule prohibiting borrowers from using personal loans to purchase gold.
this measure is part of an effort to reduce the demand for gold, with banks now specifying that loan proceeds, including personal loans, must not be used for buying gold exceeding the approved limits.
this directive is in response to the reserve bank of india's instructions to banks and nbfcs to control the demand for gold, which had contributed to widening the current account deficit.
the guidelines stipulate that banks cannot grant loans for the acquisition of any form of gold, such as primary gold, gold bullion, gold jewelry, gold coins, units of gold exchange-traded funds, or units of gold mutual funds.
furthermore, the rbi has imposed a restriction on the weight of specially minted gold coins that can be used as collateral, with a limit of 50 grams per customer as noted by a senior official from a public bank.
in a recent development, the rbi has limited gold imports by banks to cater exclusively to the requirements of gold jewelry exporters, and has also banned the import of gold coins and medallions without the necessary license.
to ensure domestic utilization, nominated banks, agencies, and other entities are advised to supply gold only to jewelry businesses, bullion dealers, and banks authorized under the gold deposit scheme, against full upfront payment.
the government has also increased the import duty on gold to 10 percent as part of its strategies to control imports.
notably, gold imports saw a significant rise in july to 47 tonnes compared to 31 tonnes in the previous month, contributing to an 87 percent increase in gold imports from april to july, totaling 383 tonnes.

a recent study conducted by researchers from the university of alberta has unveiled the mystery behind the popping sound produced when cracking knuckles.
according to lead author and u of a professor greg kawchuk, the sound is a result of a momentary vacuum-like gap forming in the lubricating synovial fluid between the finger and knuckle bones when the joints are pulled apart too far, creating a gas-filled space that triggers the sound.
kawchuk hopes that this new understanding could lead to advancements in joint health, offering better insights into spinal injuries, knee problems, and other joint-related issues long before symptoms manifest.
using mri scans to capture a knuckle cracking in slow motion, kawchuk's international team of scientists observed a brief dark pocket forming between the knuckle and finger bones as they were separated, followed by a flash of white just before the crack occurred.
this discovery, never seen before, provides a foundation for further exploration using advanced mri technology.
the study confirmed that the force generated during knuckle cracking is potent enough to harm hard surfaces, yet medical research has not found any adverse effects on individuals who engage in this habit.
kawchuk anticipates that these research findings will pave the way for more studies on joint health and arthritic pain, suggesting a potential link between the ability to crack knuckles and joint well-being.
the study, shedding light on the mechanisms behind knuckle cracking, was detailed in the april 15 issue of the journal plos one.

in kunming, a total of 22 fraudulent apple stores were exposed by authorities.
the investigation was triggered by the dissemination of images showcasing a remarkably authentic replica.
initially, five illicit stores were identified, leading to the closure of two for operating without a proper license.
chinese trade officials subsequently confirmed that 22 unlawful establishments were appropriating apple's brand and logo.
the scrutiny of unauthorized apple stores in kunming was instigated after an american resident published a blog post narrating a visit to one such store.
the blog post, which described the imitation as a "beautiful rip-off," detailed the meticulous replication of the genuine apple store's decor and ambiance.
employees were observed donning identical colored t-shirts and sporting lanyards mirroring those of actual apple staff.
the blog post garnered significant global attention, prompting chinese trade authorities in kunming to take swift action.
the local administration for industry and commerce uncovered multiple shops infringing on apple's registered trademarks.
these offending stores have been instructed to cease using the logos, as chinese laws prohibit the imitation of another company's "look and feel" without authorization.
the source of products sold by these retailers – whether sourced from apple's authorized distributors or the grey market – remains unclear.
the kunming retail watchdog has pledged to intensify monitoring efforts and has established a hotline for the public to report unauthorized apple outlets.

according to the new york times, the nfl is set to notify teams on tuesday about adjustments to the positioning of the umpire in the offensive backfield.
these changes are a response to the recent rule modification that shifted the umpire from the heart of the defense to a position 14 to 17 yards behind the offense for safety purposes.
following the hall of fame game, the placement was altered to 12 yards back to expedite ball spotting.
despite this modification, the rule faced backlash from indianapolis colts quarterback peyton manning after his team received penalties for snapping the ball before the umpire was properly positioned during a preseason match on thursday.
subsequent modifications, established after a conference call involving members of the league's competition committee, now stipulate that the umpire should only be positioned behind the farthest offensive player.
quarterbacks are allowed to glance at officials by the sidelines for approval to snap the ball, eliminating the need to turn around and search for a signal from the umpire.
today, it was revealed that more than 81,000 incidents have been reported on railway tracks since 2012.
according to the minister of state for railways, in 2012 there were 16,336 incidents on railway tracks, in 2013 there were 19,997, and in 2014 the number rose to 24,393.
by november of the current year, there had been 20,312 incidents reported.
sinha, acknowledged the increase in deaths on railway tracks.
he attributed these incidents to various factors such as trespassing, disregarding safety instructions, avoiding overpasses, using mobile devices while crossing tracks, and falling from moving trains.
sinha emphasized that injured individuals are swiftly removed from the tracks.
in cases where there are injuries in remote locations, the guard of the train notifies the station superintendent of the nearest station who then arranges for medical help and informs the police.

during medieval times, readers expected that books would feature both text and images.
to meet this expectation, printers swiftly incorporated woodcut images in between blocks of text, paving the way for a more efficient process that eliminated the need for hand-painting.
this method not only saved valuable time and money but also maintained the essential text and illustration format that remained significant during the renaissance period.
historically, about one-third of all incunabula, books printed before the year 1501, were illustrated, and the practice of hand-coloring images persisted up until the 18th century.
despite printing being in its early stages before 1501, the method of using movable type on a wooden press remained largely unchanged for the next 350 years.
progress was seen in the book format, with the introduction of title pages - a departure from medieval scribes who traditionally added their names, completion dates, and sometimes a brief prayer at the end of manuscripts.
by the early 16th century, page numbers had become a standard feature in books.

officials in bihar, northern india, have reported that a tragic stampede at a hindu religious festival in the state capital of patna has claimed the lives of at least 32 individuals, with many of the victims being women and children.
anjani kumar singh, bihar's chief secretary, informed the bbc that 24 others sustained injuries and were rushed to a local hospital.
the stampede occurred during festivities for the dussehra festival at patna's gandhi maidan.
the exact cause of the stampede remains unclear, but eyewitnesses told of a chaotic scene where panic ensued after news circulated among the crowd that an electrical wire had fallen.
reports suggest the stampede originated in a narrow path as the throngs were dispersing from the event venue.
journalist niraj sahay, present at the venue, detailed that only one exit had been opened for people to exit, leading to the overcrowding that exacerbated the tragic incident.
the incident serves as a grim reminder of the dangers associated with large gatherings during hindu festivals in india, which sometimes witness poor crowd management and have previously resulted in significant casualties.
tragically, similar stampedes have marred previous hindu festivals, including a somber event in august when 10 individuals lost their lives in a stampede during the somvati amavasya festival in central india and a devastating incident in october 2013 where 91 pilgrims perished in a stampede near the ratangarh temple in madhya pradesh state.

san francisco is contemplating a new law that would prevent delivery robots from operating on the city's sidewalks.
the robots, previously only seen in science fiction films, are now being tested in real life.
supervisor norman yee introduced legislation on tuesday to prohibit these robots from traversing san francisco's streets.
yee, speaking to the san francisco chronicle, mentioned that while he initially thought about regulating the robots, he ultimately deemed that enforcing rules would be impractical.
"i want to ensure the safety of our sidewalks for everyone," yee stated.
he emphasized that seniors, children, and individuals with disabilities may find it challenging to avoid these robots.
food delivery startup marble currently utilizes a few robots to carry out deliveries in san francisco's mission and potrero hill neighborhoods.
these robots, standing slightly over 4 feet tall and mounted on an electric wheelchair base, can accommodate up to four grocery bags.
equipped with various sensors, including lidar technology similar to that used in self-driving cars, the robots are designed to navigate city sidewalks.
they operate at a gentle pace of 3 to 4 miles per hour.
the ceo of marble emphasized their commitment to safety, expressing willingness to collaborate with supervisors, local groups, and others to create well-informed regulations that strike a balance between pedestrian safety, local businesses, manufacturing, and innovation.
website owners can now gain valuable insights into the traffic their websites receive from twitter with the introduction of twitter web analytics, a new tool unveiled on tuesday.
developed by backtype, a social analytics company acquired by twitter in july, this tool aims to provide website owners with enhanced data on the effectiveness of their twitter integrations.
christopher golda, founder of backtype and now a member of the twitter platform team, highlighted that twitter web analytics will offer insights on three crucial aspects: the extent to which their content is shared on twitter, the volume of traffic driven by twitter, and the performance of tweet buttons.
this beta tool is currently available to a select group of partners with a wider rollout to all website owners expected in the coming weeks.
additionally, an api will be made accessible to developers for further integration and analysis.

the new york assembly has made progress towards passing a bill that would mandate labels on food products containing genetically modified crop ingredients.
the assembly's consumer affairs and protection committee approved the measure on tuesday, although a full assembly vote has yet to be scheduled.
advocates argue that the labels would provide valuable information to consumers.

recent criticism has been directed towards the prolonged period it takes for lapped cars to unlapped themselves and rejoin the back of the field in formula 1 races.
at times, backmarkers have taken multiple laps to catch up, causing delays for race director charlie whiting to restart the race.
to address this issue, a proposal has been put forward to discuss potential solutions during a sporting regulations working group meeting at the brazilian grand prix.
one approach under consideration is for lapped cars to drop back to the rear of the field instead of unlapping themselves.
in this scenario, these cars would be given an additional lap to prevent them from being disadvantaged.
such a system could facilitate quicker race restarts within a single lap of receiving the instruction, thereby reducing the time taken to bring in the safety car.
the meeting will also cover topics such as revisions to f1's engine penalty regulations, the adequacy of the current five-second penalty for driving violations, the possibility of utilizing current cars in show events, and potential changes to parc ferme restrictions.

opentraffic is a global data platform that processes anonymous positions of vehicles and smartphones into both real-time and historical traffic statistics.
the project is being developed openly, utilizing completely open-source software and engaging with an expanding network of partners.
opentraffic is actively seeking collaboration with vehicle fleet operators, app developers, and governmental entities to advance the platform.
if you collect traffic or location data, you are encouraged to join their community of data contributors to share anonymized traffic statistics.
this collaboration enhances the quality and timeliness of the data while also benefiting your own applications and contributing to improving transport outcomes globally.
if you require traffic data for your applications or city, opentraffic offers historical and real-time travel speeds for precise routing, estimated time of arrival, and transportation analysis.
by signing up for their newsletter, you can stay informed about the development of the opentraffic platform, including updates on apis and data availability.
as a nonprofit organization, opentraffic coordinates the development of open-source software and data collection efforts within the transport sector, with special recognition to ben richardson for generously donating the project domain name.

in a controversial ruling, a court in germany has determined that performing circumcision on young boys for religious grounds constitutes bodily harm.
this decision has sparked criticism from jewish and muslim communities, as the court emphasized the child's right to physical integrity over parental and religious freedoms.
the case involved a doctor who conducted a circumcision on a four-year-old resulting in medical complications.
while male circumcision is permissible in germany unlike female genital mutilation, the court argued that the child's fundamental right to bodily autonomy supersedes parental rights.

researchers in melbourne have identified the immune system's "kill switch," responsible for destroying blood stem cells during infection or chemotherapy.
published in the journal immunity, scientists at the walter and eliza hall institute of medical research revealed that this mechanism, while necessary for protecting the body during infection, can be detrimental when it becomes excessive, especially in cancer patients and those with sepsis.
by preventing these signals, researchers were able to halt the self-destruction of blood stem cells, prevent cell death post-chemotherapy, and enhance recovery from infections.
these findings offer promising prospects for developing treatments for sepsis and improving recovery outcomes in patients undergoing chemotherapy.

tim farrar, a satellite communications consultant based in menlo park, california, is part of a team of satellite experts investigating the possible location of flight 370.
he expressed surprise that the search area had not been extended further southwest.
the aircraft vanished on march 8 with 239 individuals on board during a flight from kuala lumpur, malaysia, to beijing.
farrar noted that the current search location aligns with the theory that the plane traveled south at a speed of approximately 380 knots after disappearing from malaysian radar near the northern end of the strait of malacca.
while the sea floor area examined in april and may, following acoustic pings detected by us navy contractors, suggested a slower speed of 325 knots, farrar and his independent expert team operated on the assumption of a faster speed ranging from 460 to 470 knots.
farrar questioned why the search efforts seemed geared towards a slower trajectory.
he speculated that this discrepancy could be due to authorities considering scenarios where the plane veered west before turning south or did not follow a linear route.
the australian government has announced plans to reveal the updated search area by the month's end.

scientists have successfully integrated human genes into 300 dairy cows, enabling them to produce milk that mirrors the properties of human breast milk.
with high levels of essential nutrients, human breast milk has the potential to enhance infants' immune systems and lower the chances of infections.
the researchers involved in this groundbreaking study envision that milk from genetically modified cow herds could serve as a viable substitute for both human breast milk and conventional formula milk, which frequently faces criticism for being an inadequate alternative.
they anticipate that dairy products derived from these genetically modified cow herds could eventually be available for purchase in supermarkets.
backed by a prominent biotechnology company, this research is expected to ignite further controversy surrounding genetically modified foods.
opponents of gm technology and animal welfare organizations have voiced concerns about the safety of milk produced by genetically modified animals and its potential impact on the health of the cattle involved.

two tugs have been dispatched to stabilize the shen neng 1, which ran aground on douglas shoal, situated 43 miles east of great keppel island off the coast of queensland, on a saturday.
authorities caution that the process of removing the vessel may take weeks and that it poses a significant risk of potentially spilling hundreds of tonnes of oil onto the reef during the delicate operation.
the leakage of oil from the coal carrier has already resulted in a slick spanning two miles on the ocean's surface, although the rate of oil leakage has decreased.
concerns persist, however, about the possibility of the ship breaking up in the three-meter swell, with the vessel's constant shifting in strong winds causing substantial damage to the reef beneath it.
queensland premier anna bligh has stated that the expenses associated with salvaging the ship and cleaning up the spill will be billed to its owners, cosco group.
the shen neng 1, carrying 975 tonnes of heavy fuel oil and 65,000 tonnes of coal, had veered more than 15 miles off its designated shipping lane and was traveling at full speed when it collided with the reef.
initial assessments indicate damage to the main engine room, the main engine, and the rudder, with the vessel still in motion on the reef due to the sea's action causing further harm.
aircraft have been deployed to disperse substances over the two-tonne oil slick, contained in two patches.
despite these efforts, a visible stretch of damaged coral extending for miles from the ship has been observed.
conservationists are urging for stricter regulations on the numerous ships passing near the reef annually.
douglas shoal, where the incident occurred, is a restricted area for commercial vessels as it falls within the great barrier reef marine park.
the shen neng 1's presence in the forbidden zone will be investigated by the australian transport safety bureau.

a belgian murderer and rapist serving a life sentence is set to have his life ended by doctors following a landmark decision based on belgium's euthanasia laws.
frank van den bleeken, who argued that he saw no possibility of release due to his persistent violent sexual urges, wishes to exercise his right to medically assisted suicide to put an end to years of mental torment.
an innovative move in assisted suicide, belgium has taken a significant step in granting this request.
according to his lawyer, jos vander velpen, multiple doctors and psychologists have evaluated van den bleeken over the years and unanimously agree that his suffering is unbearable.
this judicial ruling, which marks the first instance involving a prisoner since the introduction of the euthanasia law 12 years ago, signifies a new chapter in belgium's approach to assisted suicide.

a new report from the uk drug policy commission is set to reveal that enforcement officers, such as police and customs, have acknowledged the challenging task of eradicating the uk drugs market.
the study notes that traditional enforcement methods like arrests and drug seizures have little to no long-term effect on reducing the drug supply.
in some instances, these actions have even worsened the situation by triggering turf wars or causing drug markets to relocate to more sensitive locations like near schools or residential areas.
the report suggests a shift towards a new strategy that focuses on addressing the specific harms created by drug markets in each community, whether it's increased violence or heightened fear of crime.
the commission, an independent think-tank, supports a policy that may involve relocating drug markets to minimize negative impacts rather than shutting them down entirely.
tough decisions will have to be made, such as weighing the reduction of certain harms against the potential rise of others, like moving a drug market from one area to another.
the report, titled "refocusing drug related law enforcement to address harms," also proposes providing support for the families of arrested drug dealers as another way to mitigate harms.
a survey of 400 enforcement officers conducted for the study revealed that 90% believe eradicating the uk drug market in the near future is highly unlikely.
the report highlights that drug markets are vast, adaptable, and quick to fill any gaps, rendering traditional enforcement methods ineffective.
it stresses that arrests and seizures have minimal enduring impact on the harm inflicted on communities.
different areas may experience varying degrees of collateral damage from drug markets, thus enforcement efforts should prioritize addressing the most harmful impacts specific to each locale.
the report underscores the importance of evaluating all enforcement operations to ensure they have delivered positive outcomes for communities.

president trump is set to go to the treasury department on friday to sign an executive order and two memoranda pertaining to financial matters.
according to a white house spokesperson speaking to the washington examiner, the executive order will task the treasury with reducing burdens imposed by tax regulations issued in 2016, whereas the remaining directives will delve into evaluating two specific provisions of the 2010 dodd-frank financial reform law.
the first aspect under scrutiny is the protocol for government intervention and resolution of troubled banks to prevent a disorderly collapse, which some conservatives criticize as resembling an automatic bailout.
the second area of focus is on the financial stability oversight council, a regulatory body responsible for identifying potential threats to the financial system and designating certain nonbank firms for stringent regulation akin to large banks.
critics among conservatives argue that the council lacks accountability.
notably, the treasury is already acting on a prior executive order that mandates the preparation of a report by secretary steven mnuchin forecasting ways to alleviate regulatory burdens, with the secretary scheduled to deliver the report in june containing recommendations for regulatory and legislative adjustments.

previously, new york's firefighters primarily focused on inspecting high-priority buildings like schools and libraries, with other inspections being somewhat random.

according to research, horses in australia have caused more fatalities in recent years than all venomous animals combined.
ronelle welton from the university of melbourne analyzed data from hospital admissions and coronial records between 2000 and 2013.
during this period, horses were responsible for 74 deaths, surpassing bees and other stinging insects which caused 27 fatalities, and snakes which also claimed 27 lives but led to fewer hospitalizations.
interestingly, spiders did not cause any deaths during this timeframe.
welton's study, published in the internal medicine journal, challenges stereotypes regarding australia's venomous creatures.
while the focus was on animals that bite and sting, the research revealed the significant number of deaths related to horse incidents.
welton highlighted the unexpected finding that insects were the leading cause of hospital admissions, overturning common perceptions about australia's venomous wildlife.
the study emphasized that allergic reactions to bites or stings posed the most substantial risk.

the innovative game format features only seven players per team on the field, a significant reduction from the traditional 18-a-side format.
this initiative is part of the afl's strategic plan to establish itself as a year-round sporting option.

to enhance the quality of mental health services, the report advocates for measures such as mandatory mental health training for gps and relevant staff, a dedicated phone line for mental health appointments, a 'red flag' system in patient files to alert receptionists of mental health concerns, and provision for extended appointments for individuals with mental health challenges.

american superconductor corporation is a global provider of megawatt-scale solutions, operating in two main segments: wind and grid.
under the wind segment, the company designs wind turbine systems and licenses these designs under the windtec solutions brand to third parties.
additionally, it supplies power electronics, software-based control systems, and offers customer support services to wind turbine manufacturers.
the wind segment's design portfolio includes a variety of drivetrains and power ratings up to 2 megawatts.
in the grid segment, the company provides products and services that facilitate power connection, transmission, and distribution for electric utilities and renewable energy project developers under the gridtec solutions brand.
services offered by this segment include transmission planning services, grid interconnection solutions for wind and solar power plants, power quality systems, and transmission and distribution cable systems.
moreover, the grid segment offers resilient electric grid systems for protection against critical substation failures in urban areas, ship protection systems to lower a naval ship's magnetic signature, flexible alternating current transmission systems for power flow and voltage control, and standalone fault current limiters acting as surge protectors for the power grid.
founded in 1987, american superconductor corporation is headquartered in ayer, massachusetts.

encountering a qr code can sometimes be a slightly cumbersome experience involving tapping your barcode scanner, aiming it at the peculiar blocks, and then watching a link open in your browser, leading you to a website or an app download.
the physical web aims to enhance the connection between phones and their surroundings.
in this scenario, instead of qr codes, the focus is on eddystone bluetooth low-energy beacons.
simply being in proximity to one will trigger a notification on your device.
chrome on ios already supports the physical web, and the web bluetooth api began rolling out to the chrome dev channel for android a few months back, with its integration into the chrome 49 beta underway.
when a new user passes by a beacon for the first time, a notification prompts them to activate the physical web.
subsequently, they will view a collection of nearby urls within a discreet notification that does not disrupt them with vibrations.
after further rounds of testing, this feature is expected to be included in the stable release of chrome once version 49 becomes available on devices.

bubblesoft, known for their popular bubbleupnp app, has recently released an android server counterpart.
previously, users could utilize a bubbleupnp server on various platforms such as windows, mac, linux, raspberry pi, or a nas, and then access or share local media using the player app on android.
now, android devices can also function as servers with a few important considerations in mind.
although the app is available, users need to locate it as it is designed with a minimalistic approach and lacks user-friendly guidance.
additionally, it is not recommended to run the bubbleupnp server on daily driver devices due to its persistent running nature and significant battery consumption.
however, for those with spare devices like fire tv or nexus player, or a device with ample cpu power and consistent access to a power source, this new server app can be a valuable addition.
despite this, bubblesoft cautions against using android hardware as servers unless necessary, which is why the app is not listed on the play store to prevent negative reviews and potential device overheating issues.
those interested in using the server app can obtain the apk file from bubblesoft's official website after understanding and accepting these caveats.

during the early 20th century, detroit, michigan, emerged as a prominent city due to the rapid growth of the automobile industry and associated manufacturers.
in the 1940s, the city experienced a period of significant development marked by upheaval and transformation.
factories shifted their focus to producing war machines, leading to a transition in roles as women stepped into positions traditionally held by men who were serving overseas during world war ii.
this demand for labor attracted a wave of african-american workers to detroit, facing resistance from white residents who opposed their integration into neighborhoods and workplaces.
the racial tensions culminated in a three-day race riot in 1943, resulting in 34 fatalities and numerous injuries.
following the end of world war ii, the demand for labor decreased, prompting detroit to strategize for the postwar era with a focus on large automobiles and the construction of expansive highways to support the city's automotive industry.

the audubon aquarium of the americas has recently introduced a new guest dive program, the maya dive adventure, offering certified scuba divers and snorkelers the opportunity to swim alongside a variety of marine species.
participants can enjoy a 45-minute experience in the 132,000-gallon great maya reef exhibit, teeming with yellow-tailed snapper, cownose stingrays, caribbean spiny lobsters, angel fish, and numerous other colorful reef dwellers.
this trend of guest dive programs has gained popularity in aquariums nationwide, providing visitors with an up-close nature encounter while generating additional revenue for the facilities.
the new orleans aquarium, established in 1990, has had a dedicated team of volunteer scuba divers responsible for maintaining the exhibits and feeding the marine life.
the maya dive adventure marks the first time the aquarium's underwater habitats have been accessible to the public, exclusively for certified scuba divers.
aspiring divers without certification can opt for snorkeling, immersing themselves in the 78-degree water and encountering marine life while gliding through a 30-foot-long glass tunnel.

in their research paper, finn brunton and helen nissenbaum discuss how computer-driven data collection and analysis have fundamentally transformed modern surveillance practices.
they argue that in today's society, refusing to participate in data collection is practically impossible due to its integration into essential societal transactions.
the authors introduce a strategy named obfuscation as a grassroots response to pervasive surveillance, in which individuals intentionally generate confusing or misleading data to hinder oversight efforts.
they explore various motives behind obfuscation and outline a political theory that draws connections between historical and contemporary instances.
by examining cases like radar chaff and bittorrent, the paper presents a comprehensive analysis of obfuscation, highlighting its role in challenging surveillance systems.

modern chemical exposures are defined by a widespread contamination consisting of numerous chemicals, including many endocrine disruptors, present at low levels.
traditional approaches employed by regulatory agencies globally, which examine chemicals individually, struggle to address this complex pollution mixture adequately.
a significant hurdle lies in evaluating the cumulative effects of multiple endocrine disruptors and other chemicals, all at minimal concentrations.
our review traces the evolution of experimental and conceptual methodologies essential for analyzing mixtures at low doses, particularly focusing on endocrine disruptors.
evidence from nearly two decades of research indicates combined effects at levels approaching experimental thresholds.
an existing challenge is assessing the significance of this evidence due to insufficient knowledge about the array of endocrine disruptors forming these combined exposures.
it is imperative to bridge these knowledge gaps promptly, an issue currently under deliberation in exposome research discussions.

in india, there exists a unique cultural practice known as shastra puja or ayudha puja, translating to weapon worship.
this tradition occurs annually in september during a religious festival dedicated to the goddess durga.
participants adorn their weapons with flowers and religious ornaments, offering prayers as a gesture of gratitude for the protection these tools provide.
while in the past, bows, arrows, and swords were revered, the introduction and widespread adoption of firearms have integrated them into this ritual.
over time, this observance has evolved to encompass a broader range of tools essential for livelihood, such as vehicles, hand tools, and machinery.
among the kodava tribe, weapon worship holds particular significance, as weapons have been integral to their culture for generations.
they uphold a strong tradition of firearm ownership, instilling in their children a deep respect for guns along with a thorough understanding of the associated responsibilities and advantages.

in the previous week, another soldier from north korea defected by walking across the heavily fortified border that separates the two nations.
historically, the rate of defections stood at about one per year.

seoul has recorded that over 30,000 north koreans have defected to the south post-korean war, with most crossing through china, which shares the longest border with north korea.

the wall street journal reported on thursday that the department of justice is preparing to file a lawsuit against apple over accusations of colluding to manipulate e-book prices.
it was noted that publishers traditionally sold books to retailers at roughly half of the suggested retail price, allowing retailers the freedom to set their own prices.
however, apple shifted its e-book operations to an "agency model," where publishers could determine the selling price at a specific retailer while considering apple's 30 percent share of each sale.
additionally, apple imposed restrictions that prevented publishers from offering lower prices on other platforms.
walter isaacson quoted steve jobs revealing that publishers extended this model to other e-book sellers, requiring them to abide by apple's price guidelines to avoid underpricing.
the companies being scrutinized for their involvement with apple in this arrangement include simon and schuster, hachette book group, the penguin group, macmillan, and harpercollins.
the doj contends that these practices violate antitrust regulations and is seeking a settlement with the implicated entities.
if an agreement is not reached, the doj is prepared to take legal action against apple and the publishers involved.
many individuals in the american midwest trace their ancestry back to germany, with a significant number able to recount a cherished traditional holiday practice from the old country - the weihnachtsgurke, or christmas pickle.
they will explain that a pickle-shaped ornament is traditionally the final one to be placed on the tree on christmas eve, hidden amongst the pine needles.
the ornament may vary in appearance, with options such as a shiny or matte finish, gold swirls, or a miniature santa hat.
the legend dictates that the first child to spot the pickle in the morning will receive good fortune in the upcoming year, along with a special gift.
while this narrative seems feasible considering the germans' fondness for both christmas and traditions, it is interesting to note that this custom is virtually unheard of in germany itself.
in a survey conducted by the yougov polling agency in november, which included 2,057 german participants, a staggering 91 percent had never encountered this holiday tale associated with their homeland.

the united states space agency, nasa, is preparing to send a 3d printer into space next year to enable astronauts to produce spare parts and tools in a zero gravity environment.
this groundbreaking initiative aims to cut down on the expenses of future missions and marks the first utilization of a 3d printer in space.
the printer, about the size of a microwave oven, will need to endure the vibrations of lift-off and function securely within the confines of a space station.
nasa has enlisted the services of technology start-up made in space to develop the printer.
aaron kemmer, the company's ceo, illustrated the potential impact by envisioning an astronaut in need of urgent repairs on the international space station.
utilizing a 3d printer would enable the on-demand creation of required parts instead of relying on pre-existing supplies.
highlighting the significance of adaptability, dave korsmeyer, nasa's ames research center engineering director, emphasized that the ability to design and produce items in real-time through 3d printing is invaluable for space exploration.
additionally, nasa is exploring the use of 3d printing to produce small satellites that could be deployed from the international space station to transmute data back to earth.
while traditional 3d printing predominantly uses polymer materials in layer-by-layer construction, advancements now include the deployment of laser-melted titanium and nickel-chromium powders for the production of more robust components.
nasa recently achieved a milestone by conducting a successful test of a metal 3d printed rocket component, aligning with its commitment to diminishing the costs associated with space ventures.

luxembourg uzbek troops have been sternly suppressing dissent, and despite ongoing human rights concerns in the country, the eu has decided to lift an arms embargo against uzbekistan.
the embargo was initially enforced in 2005 following the government's violent crackdown on mainly unarmed opposition protesters in andijan, resulting in over 100 casualties.
eu foreign ministers believe that by lifting the embargo, they can encourage uzbek authorities to enhance human rights practices.
nonetheless, international human rights organizations have vehemently criticized this decision, citing the country's refusal to conduct an international inquiry into the andijan events in 2005.
the recent lifting of the arms embargo by the eu followed the release of political prisoners and the abolition of the death penalty in uzbekistan.
factors such as the country's strategic location in central asia, its abundant energy resources, and its support in providing aid to german troops in nearby afghanistan played a significant role in the decision.
eu foreign ministers have expressed ongoing concerns regarding human rights in uzbekistan and have agreed to reassess the situation in a year.
they have urged uzbek authorities to release all imprisoned human rights advocates, guarantee freedom of speech, and combat child labor.
however, organizations like human rights watch and amnesty international have condemned the eu's move, stating that it fails not only the victims of andijan, but also numerous human rights activists and journalists who continue to face persecution, torture, and detention in uzbekistan.

known as ta-ra to the gadigal people, the original inhabitants, the area now recognized as millers point derived its name from the windmills established in the hills and their proprietor john leighton, famously called jack the miller.
by the 1850s, millers point had transformed into a maritime community, predominantly occupied by residents and workers associated with the docks and the trade industry they supported.
following an outbreak of the bubonic plague in 1900, the government assumed authority over all the wharves and adjacent streets, initiating an extensive urban renewal project.
this era marked the development of significant public infrastructures in sydney, including the construction of wharves spanning from woolloomooloo to white bay and the iconic harbour bridge.
despite enduring the challenges of the plague, economic depression, and wartime pressures, the community in millers point faced a grave threat in the 1970s when the askin government proposed high-rise developments in the vicinity.
notably, the intervention of jack mundey and the green ban movement during the early 1970s successfully safeguarded many historic buildings, parks, and green spaces in the area.
the campaign was not solely aimed at preserving architectural heritage but also at safeguarding the welfare of millers point's low-income populace.

in contrast, 83 percent of republicans align with israelis.
the overall statistic for all americans stands at 62 percent.
despite these numbers, the trend analysis based on party affiliation reveals more complexity.
the 48 percent of democrats supporting israelis has notably increased since the mid-1990s, resembling a similar upward trajectory among republicans.
however, within the last year, democratic support for israelis has decreased by approximately ten points, which mirrors a decline observed across all parties after a surge of support during the first gulf war.

the emissions predominantly comprised of vapour and gas, considered less hazardous to air travel than ash, billowed from the volcano.
seismic disturbances since august 16 have fractured the vatnajokull glacier to the northeast, allowing molten lava to flow through the ruptures.
the current alert status remains at orange, suggesting escalating restiveness and a heightened likelihood of an eruption.
concerns mount as the lava flows extend towards the north and potentially underneath the glacier, with ongoing tremors signaling the potential for a violent sub-glacial eruption.

tourists were evacuated from the area due to intense seismic events preceding the volcanic activity surge in the past 72 hours.

researchers from china and singapore have utilized electrospinning technology to develop a stand-alone catalyst capable of producing hydrogen and oxygen, with potential for large-scale industrial production.
in water-splitting devices, electrocatalysis is used for oxygen reduction and hydrogen evolution.
while platinum-based catalysts are commonly recognized as highly efficient, their cost and durability limitations hinder widespread application.
to address these challenges, electrospinning has been employed to produce fibers that enable the creation of scalable electrocatalysts.
however, previous catalysts have faced issues such as limited active sites and inefficient mass transport pathways.
shengjie peng from the national university of singapore and xiaohong qin from donghua university, leading a team of researchers, successfully resolved these shortcomings.
by synthesizing porous, channel-rich carbon nanofibers from a combination of pyrolyzed electrospun polyacrylonitrile and cellulose acetate nanofibers, the researchers were able to introduce essential active sites and improve mass transport pathways.
they incorporated iron-based precursors into the spinning solution as cost-effective and efficient electrocatalysts.
the resulting novel material enabled the team to fabricate a flexible and stable 180 x 80cm electrocatalyst with impressive performance.
their breakthrough is anticipated to accelerate the development of next-generation flexible electrodes.

the concept of phase transformations in periodic cellular materials is expanded by introducing materials with unit cells containing multiple stable configurations, where each configuration represents a stable phase.
transitioning between these phases within the cellular material is considered a phase transformation.
a specific cellular material showcasing phase transformations is examined to determine the unit cell geometry elements influencing its mechanical properties.
moreover, an analytical model is introduced to depict its constitutive behavior.
these materials displaying phase transformations exhibit hysteresis with extended, jagged loading and unloading plateaus, making them advantageous for energy absorption applications.
although these phase-transforming cellular materials exhibit energy absorption capabilities comparable to metal and polymeric honeycombs, a notable distinction is their fully recoverable deformations.

these individuals are forced to wear the same soiled clothing for days and even weeks without any means to wash or change into clean undergarments.
accessing a shared uncleaned toilet amidst a sea of other inmates proves to be a daunting task, leading to the spread of untreated illnesses and infections among the population.
the lack of proper hygiene facilities results in inmates going without showers for extended periods, while they shiver in the cold clutching onto thin blankets, pleading with guards for warmer coverings.
basic necessities like menstrual hygiene products are not provided, and medical attention, including essential medications, is routinely denied, causing inmates to suffer from significant weight loss and dehydration due to the unpalatable water source available to them.
the agonizing cries of fellow inmates grappling with unchecked medical conditions resonate through the cell block, as these individuals languish without access to resources like books, legal materials, entertainment, or exposure to natural light.

formerly, the age of consent for anal intercourse was 18, while it stood at 16 for all other sexual activities.

these resources enable developers to code for nvidia gpus using nvapi, rather than conventional apis like directx or opengl, along with assisting in game testing and debugging.
androidworks, an expansion of the tegra android developer pack, seeks to streamline game development for android by offering libraries, sample code, and performance profiling and debugging tools.
while initially designed for nvidia devices, androidworks is compatible with a range of devices, with successful testing on various platforms including the x86-based asus memopad, google nexus player, nexus 7, and galaxy tab s.
improving on the native development experience provided by the android sdk and ndk, androidworks integrates seamlessly with microsoft's visual studio ide on windows.

cpython relies on reference counting to manage the object's lifespan, considered a common practice due to its simplicity in implementation.
despite its widespread acceptance, dealing with reference counting can be complex for those unfamiliar with it.
the cpython api introduces intricacies to reference counting; varying on its state, references can be new, borrowed, stolen, or copied.
functions typically return new and borrowed references; when you receive a new reference, you become its owner and must decrement the reference count when no longer needed.
borrowed references allow viewing, requiring an increment in the reference count if the object is to be retained.
stolen and copied references, conversely, are passed as function arguments, relieving the responsibility of managing the reference count.
while comprehending each function's handling of references in c may seem daunting, the design often streamlines reference-count adjustments, reducing the manual intervention required.
however, for the writer, managing the complexities associated with potential side effects and interactions of reference counts remains a challenge, requiring meticulous attention to eliminate any bugs related to reference counting intricacies.

aldf new orleans - an animal rights organization has filed a lawsuit to rescue candy the chimpanzee from an amusement park where reports indicate she is engaging in smoking cigarettes and being offered soft drinks instead of water.
the lawsuit, brought forth by the animal legal defense fund in baton rouge, contends that candy is housed in substandard conditions at a baton rouge park and advocates for her relocation to a sanctuary.
the legal action, initiated on tuesday, is supported by two women who have been advocating for candy's move from the dixie landin' park.
according to the lawsuit, the women have witnessed visitors tossing lit cigarettes into candy's enclosure for her to smoke.
attorney carter dillard highlighted that this lawsuit marks the first legal challenge under a new federal regulation mandating equivalent protection for captive chimpanzees compared to their wild counterparts.
the park's owner, sam haynes, has yet to provide a response to requests for comments.
legislation has been introduced allowing authorities in australia to gather and monitor individuals' internet activities, comprising their browsing history, social media interactions, and emails.
these laws are aimed at suspected cyber criminals but fall short of the more extensive proposed regulations that sought to retain all internet usage data for every australian for two years on grounds of national security.
under the new laws passed recently, law enforcement agencies, such as state and federal police, are empowered to oblige isps to maintain internet records of individuals under suspicion of cyber crimes like fraud and child exploitation.
these records will only be preserved from the moment of the request, and access will be granted to authorities only upon obtaining a warrant.
the challenge arises as some isps retain data for a brief period, whereas others routinely erase user data daily, posing difficulties for authorities in collecting evidence against suspects.

kersley appou, a 43-year-old mauritian striker, has surpassed roger milla as the oldest footballer to represent an african national team.
milla, who previously held the record, achieved the feat at the age of 42 years and 39 days when he scored against russia during the 1994 world cup.
despite losing his african national team record, milla retains his title as the oldest player and goal scorer in world cup history.
appou made his mark in mauritius's africa cup of nations qualifying match against mauritania at the age of 43 years and 354 days, as he aims to continue his playing career.
however, he is still short of the world record held by macdonald taylor sr from the us virgin islands, who played at the age of 46 years and 217 days.
milla, a veteran of three world cup tournaments, notably shone in the 1990 finals at the age of 38, where his goal celebrations, featuring dancing around a corner flag, have become iconic.

it's crucial to educate children on the important indicators when they want to pick up a cat.
emphasize the necessity of only approaching a cat that is calm, relaxed, and shows trust towards them.
it is essential to avoid situations where a child could potentially get scratched by a cat that is not comfortable being handled.
most cats will clearly communicate when they do not wish to be picked up.
while it is possible to build trust with domestic cats through gentle petting on their heads, it is not advisable to lift a cat that is agitated or not receptive to being picked up.
if a cat tries to escape, bites, scratches, or swats at you, it is best to give the cat space and attempt picking it up at a later time.
a recent legionnaires' disease outbreak in new york, the largest in the city's history, has resulted in a death toll of at least 12 individuals, prompting health authorities to urgently address the spread of the harmful bacteria.
over 100 cases have been identified in the south bronx, a community known for its economic challenges.
investigations have linked the legionella bacteria to cooling towers in multiple buildings in the area.
vulnerable populations, particularly the elderly, face higher risks associated with this type of pneumonia.
notably, the deceased were predominantly above 40 years old and had pre-existing health conditions.
extensive sanitation efforts are underway to eradicate the bacteria throughout the bronx.
legionnaires' disease is not contagious among people but is primarily disseminated through air conditioning and similar systems.
mayor bill de blasio of new york, amid criticism for the city's crisis management, acknowledged the unprecedented challenges encountered in combating this outbreak.
the disease's 10-day incubation period has caused delays in case reporting.
nonetheless, authorities are hopeful that no new cases have emerged since august 3.
the response has been marred by a lack of coordination between city and state health departments, exemplified by conflicting information during separate news conferences held by governor andrew cuomo and mayor de blasio.
this discord between the two prominent democratic leaders has complicated the overall handling of the situation, adding to previous instances of strained collaboration.

in the aftermath of the failed military coup in july 2016, turkey declared a state of emergency, a measure heavily censured by international leaders for its perceived drift towards authoritarian rule.
under the state of emergency, turkish authorities acquired the ability to dismiss public servants and prolong the detention period of suspects without formal charges.
over 100,000 individuals, including military personnel, law enforcement officers, and educators, have been relieved of their duties since the commencement of the state of emergency.
furthermore, in connection with the coup attempt, around 40,000 people have been detained on suspicion of involvement with the us-based cleric fethullah gulen, whom turkey accuses of orchestrating the coup endeavor last year.
the referendum held on sunday seeks to enhance erdogan's authority, granting him the power to craft budgets, dissolve the parliament, and appoint or remove government officials and judges without parliamentary endorsement.

the 16-year-old's self-nomination led to his suspension from school, with authorities accusing him of showing disrespect towards his black peers.
trevor, believed to be the only student at the school with african heritage, along with two friends, displayed campaign posters featuring him giving a thumbs-up gesture.
these posters were meant to be a satirical take on the term "african-american," currently used as a culturally sensitive term for black americans, according to one of his campaign managers, scott rambo.
however, the satirical intent backfired, especially as the incident coincided with martin luther king day, a significant holiday honoring the civil rights leader's contributions to the struggle for racial equality.

after a decade in office, vietnam's prime minister has resigned, leaving a complex legacy characterized by efforts to revive struggling state enterprises, attracting foreign investment, and bold confrontations with china.
the departure of nguyen tan dung was confirmed in a formal vote by 418 assembly members, representing 84% of the national assembly, who agreed to his dismissal ahead of schedule.
the assembly is poised to elect his deputy, nguyen xuan phuc, as the new prime minister.
dung's exit was precipitated by his defeat in a leadership contest during the communist party's congress, where he was ousted by nguyen phu trong, who retained his post as party general secretary for another term.
the prime minister's removal has highlighted the internal discord within the ruling communist party, with dung facing criticism for the failures of state-owned enterprises, notably the vietnam shipbuilding industry group and vietnam shipping lines, which amassed substantial public debt.
despite his charismatic leadership style and successful international engagements that elevated vietnam's global standing, dung's tenure was marred by controversies surrounding his relationships with wealthy individuals and policy decisions that divided opinion within the party.
appointed in the midst of the global financial crisis, dung faced economic challenges that he navigated, earning public support for his defiance against chinese territorial claims in the south china sea.

in a rare scientific survey commissioned by the wildlife trusts, marine life in porlock bay, somerset, was recently studied by professional divers for the first time in three decades.
the study, conducted by four divers, revealed two distinct sea bed habitats within the bay.
specifically, crustaceans like the long clawed squat lobster were documented in a boulder reef north of gore point in the bristol channel, alongside numerous sponge species.
another site explored was a sand and shell plain located in the center of porlock bay.
during the dives held in early august, sea hares and a rare stalked jellyfish were also discovered, with the latter being a species highlighted in the uk biodiversity action plan, potentially necessitating targeted protection in the future due to its habitat sensitivity.
small samples retrieved by the divers have been meticulously analyzed to classify species types and contribute to a holistic understanding of the biodiversity at each site.
the divers encountered challenges reaching the dive sites due to strong currents affecting visibility on both occasions.
the wildlife trusts expressed astonishment at the diverse species richness found in the area and emphasized the importance of understanding the habitat to facilitate effective conservation efforts going forward.

according to a recent report, the north korean government has relocated around 10,000 households to facilitate the construction of a 270 km segment of highway along the chinese border.
the main objective of this project is to prevent individuals from escaping north korea, as explained by a reliable source.
the highway, stretching from hyesan in ryanggang province to musan in north hamgyong province, is nearing its final stages of completion.
the decision to relocate the residents was prompted by the high levels of defections and smuggling activities in the border regions along the apnok and duman rivers.
this strategy aims to make it significantly more difficult for people to escape through established routes in hyesan, musan, and hoeryong, regardless of the amount of money they may offer.
although the regime had assured the resettled individuals of additional food rations as a benefit, the promised perks have not materialized, according to the source.

select a player to be the first caller for a round out of the total 26 rounds in the game.
the initial round corresponds to the letter a.
in each round, the designated caller must pick a noun with fewer than four syllables, preferably a tangible object rather than an abstract concept - unless they don't mind receiving playful punches from increasingly tipsy friends.
all participants, including the caller, are then tasked with selecting blocks from the available pool and constructing something that can be identified as the chosen noun.
there isn't a strict criterion for recognition; this aspect is typically determined through general agreement among the players.
the person who constructs the item last earns the responsibility of taking a drink.
subsequently, that individual assumes the role of the caller for the following round, which should correspond to the consecutive letter of the alphabet that the new caller can recall.
this game boasts a refined framework that usually evenly distributes consequences, as the caller has a slight time advantage, considering the time required to come up with a suitable idea.
nonetheless, excessive complexity could hinder any drinking game, particularly one involving small objects.
hence, lego marathon allows for lively discussions reminiscent of the vibrant ambiance found in renowned drinking establishments.

this flaw remains unfixed, leaving users at risk of hijacking when they unwittingly visit websites containing malicious code.
trend micro, an antivirus software company, has reported that approximately 10,000 websites have already been compromised and are exploiting this vulnerability.
these compromised sites, mostly chinese in origin, are distributing programs designed to steal passwords for online games, which can then be sold on the black market.
security researcher paul ferguson from trend micro warns that this security hole could be exploited by more malicious actors for even greater harm, highlighting the urgent need for a fix to prevent potential widespread attacks.

vice minister xu deming stated that the purpose of this bureau is to enhance the unified system design for registration.
the new bureau will be responsible for developing related regulations, registration procedures, information services, as well as document and survey standards.
additionally, xu emphasized the importance of accelerating rural land property surveying and registration and advancing the stockholding system reform in rural areas.
he highlighted the need for small cities and towns to prioritize real estate registration in their organizational and governmental reforms, while encouraging cooperation among big cities and related departments to share best practices.
the implementation of real estate registration is a crucial prerequisite for the potential introduction of a property tax in china.

in eastern china, a court has handed down prison terms ranging up to six and a half years to three activists associated with a civil rights movement advocating for government officials to openly disclose their assets.
the severity of these sentences, criticized by supporters of the trio as excessive, underscores the communist party's increasingly hard stance against any form of political dissent, irrespective of how peacefully it is expressed or how loosely organized the movement may be.
chinese authorities have been vigilant against any independent social movements that could potentially pose a threat to the party's authority by mobilizing the public, leading to the suppression of the loosely connected new citizens movement to which the three activists belonged.
in the city of xinyu, liu ping, a labor rights advocate, and wei zhongping were each sentenced to six and a half years in prison, while another activist, li sihua, received a three-year sentence, according to their lawyer, zhou ze.
the activists were found guilty of "creating a disturbance," a broadly defined charge increasingly utilized to detain activists.
additionally, liu and wei were convicted on two other charges.
lawyer si weijiang argued that there was no legal justification for the convictions, stating, "the evidence clearly proves their innocence, yet the authorities were resolute in convicting them." surprisingly, liu and wei received longer sentences than the group's founder, xu zhiyong, who was sentenced to four years earlier in the year by a court in beijing.
these prosecutions are part of a broad crackdown on political dissent that has intensified since the previous spring, resulting in the apprehension and imprisonment of numerous activists, intellectuals, human rights attorneys, bloggers, and advocates for marginalized communities.
si remarked that the underlying message being conveyed is that all political dissidents, regardless of guilt or innocence, will be prosecuted and sentenced.
as anticipated and as widely foreseen, isil ignited the mishraq chemical plant and sulphur mine located 30 km south of mosul last thursday while retreating towards the city.

the noxious cloud, comprised of toxic sulphur dioxide and hydrogen sulphide, mixed with remnants from burning oil wells, poses a grave danger to those exposed without protective gear.

the academy highlighted valve's role in cultivating a dynamic gaming community through the creation of influential titles like half life, team fortress 2, and dota 2.
newell expressed his gratitude, stating that it was an "honour" for both himself and the entire valve team.
he commended uk players of valve games, the supportive uk press, and acknowledged the contributions of british "modders" such as garry newman.
bafta's video games committee chairman, harvey elliott, lauded mr.
newell's exceptional contributions to the industry, noting that valve's unique approach allows players to not only enjoy games but also engage as creators through accessible tools for modding the studio's creations.
valve's online gaming service, steam, facilitates game purchases and management for many players, while the company is actively developing a steam "box" to enable gaming on tv screens.
past bafta fellows in the video game realm include luminaries like peter molyneux, shigeru miyamoto, and will wright.
in a similar vein, markus persson, the mastermind behind minecraft, was recognized in 2012 with a special award for the unparalleled success of the beloved block-building game.
